page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our area is basicly a bad Agricultural area but quite good for coal mining, but the mining could cease in a few years time. The land is mainly fields with few amenities. It has streams and burns , such as Haydon Letch and Potland Burn, there is also some woodland scattered round about the area. On estimate 70% of the land is rough pasture, 20% farmland and 10% mining and Government property. The mine is a major industrial component in the area. When opened it employed 4500 men but now only 600 men work there. In 1849 when the first shaft was sunk it was a great industrial boom for the area but now the changes in demand for coal could be the end of the great mining industry in Ashington
